Posts.Title: breast cancer that has led to bone cancer

Posts.Content: Hey your daughter will always think you are beautiful ! ;0) On a serious note thought I understand totally how you are feeling. When I discussed chemo with my 2 daughters, 10 and 12 at the time they both reacted totally differently. Youngest said she was shaving her head same as me and the elder distraught - obviously mums are embarrassing enough without the added wig! ;0) Its an age thing - awkward teenage stage methinks - i suppose just being open with her, asking her for suggestions will help. In the end I decided for my own reasons against the chemo route so it never came to it. But as you said yourself - its only a couple months and will be over before you know it ;0) Take care lesley xxx
Posts.Title: Hair loss and chemo

Posts.Content: I remember when I was diagnosed at Christmas I felt much the same as you. Everyone else getting upset etc etc and me just thinking whats wrong with them! Denial methinks most def !! ;0) It was only after a few months and the reality of it all that it actually sunk in. And boy was that a day for emotions, anger, hate, loss all of them. All I can say is go with the flow and as Marsha says take each day as it comes. Everyone copes and deals with things differently and you will find your own way. Talk soon and take care Lesley x
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, but why am i so calm?

Posts.Content: Sharon - You are correct in saying that if we had the choice none of us would be on this forum. But do you know I am so glad I found it for whatever reason. There are so many special lovely people on it. Im a great believer that what is meant to be will and there you are....we are here ! ;0) Tanya - I had to make a few decisions along the way in my treatment and thought that whatever I decided would be the wrong way!! But decisions made we just have to get on with it and Im sure youll be around when that son of yours starts giving you girlfriend problems !! ;0) Emma - welcome ;0) As said some great folk on here and please ask if you want to know anything or shout and scream and swear (politely of course ;0) if thats what you feel like doing !! If you get a chance try and pop in the chat room after 9 in the evening - but be prepared its a mad house ! Take care all of you and please use this forum to try and make things a little easier for your. Lesley xxx
